Description: Pottery ostracon containing a religious composition of sentences from the Psalms written in Coptic.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Sheikh Abd el-Qurna (Thebes), Monastery of Epiphanius, see curator's comments
Curator's comments: Said to be from Karnak, but O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 18.1 physically joins O.Mon.Epiph. 16B, which the 1913/1914 MMA Expedition was discovered in Cell A (MMA 806) of the Monastery of Epiphanius.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.24, pl.18)
von Lemm 1908 / Koptische Miscellen LI-LXI (p.1334-35, no.5)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (108525) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/108525)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 18:1 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2016)
